00012 int bro_bt_connect_device (int * spam_sock, bdaddr_t mac_addr)
00013 {
00014 
00015     int connect_status;    
00016     
00017     struct sockaddr_rc addr_data = { 0 };
00018     
00019     /* AF_BLUETOOTH means that it's a Bluetooth socket, while BTPROTO_RFCOMM
00020     * means that we are going to use the RFCOMM protocol to get the data.
00021     */
00022     *spam_sock = socket (AF_BLUETOOTH, SOCK_STREAM, BTPROTO_RFCOMM);
00023 
00024     /* As written on the official guide for the Bluetooth Libraries...
00025     * struct sockaddr_rc {
00026     *    sa_family_t    rc_family;
00027     *    bdaddr_t           rc_bdaddr;
00028     *    uint8_t                rc_channel;
00029     *  };
00030     * The sockaddr_rc contains various and interesting values. The
00031     * communication family, the RFCOMM channel and the MAC address :3
00032     * In here we set all this data. Fuck yea.
00033     */ 
00034     addr_data.rc_family   = AF_BLUETOOTH;
00035     addr_data.rc_channel  = (uint8_t) 1;
00036     addr_data.rc_bdaddr   = mac_addr;
00037 
00038     // Let's connect to SPAM!
00039     connect_status = connect(*spam_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&addr_data,
00040                            sizeof(addr_data));
00041 
00042     return connect_status;
00043 }

00045 size_t bro_bt_scan_devices (bro_bt_device_t *devices[MAX_BT_DEVICES])
00046 {
00047     inquiry_info *scan_res = NULL;
00048     size_t num_rsp;
00049     int dev_id, sock, flags;
00050     int i;
00051     char addr[19] = { 0 };
00052     char name[248] = { 0 };
00053     
00054     flags = IREQ_CACHE_FLUSH;
00055     
00056     // Initializing BT Device for scan
00057     dev_id = hci_get_route(NULL);
00058     sock = hci_open_dev( dev_id );
00059     
00060     if (dev_id < 0 || sock < 0) {
00061       perror("opening socket");
00062       exit(1);
00063     }
00064 
00065     memset(devices, 0, MAX_BT_DEVICES * sizeof(bro_bt_device_t *));
00066     
00067     // Allocate memory for all the devices found
00068     scan_res = (inquiry_info*)malloc(MAX_BT_DEVICES * sizeof(inquiry_info));
00069     
00070     // Scan to find all the devices in range
00071     num_rsp = hci_inquiry(dev_id, BT_INQUIRY_LEN, MAX_BT_DEVICES, NULL,
00072                           &scan_res, flags);
00073     if( num_rsp < 0 ) perror("hci_inquiry");
00074 
00075     // For each of the found devices we retrieve its name
00076     for (i = 0; i < num_rsp; i++) {
00077       ba2str(&scan_res[i].bdaddr, addr);
00078       memset(name, 0, sizeof(name));
00079       if (hci_read_remote_name(sock, &scan_res[i].bdaddr, sizeof(name), 
00080           name, 0) < 0) {
00081         strcpy(name, "[unknown]");
00082       };
00083       //devices[i]->name = strdup(name);      // todo FREE on devices elements
00084       devices[i] = malloc(sizeof(bro_bt_device_t));
00085       strcpy(devices[i]->name, name);
00086       memcpy (&devices[i]->mac, &scan_res[i].bdaddr, sizeof(bdaddr_t));
00087     }
00088 
00089     free( scan_res );
00090     close( sock );
00091     return num_rsp;
00092 }

00094 int bro_bt_client_fist (bro_fist_t * input_fist, bro_fist_t * out_fist,
00095                         int spam_sock) {
00096     
00097     bro_spam_fists_t buffer;
00098     
00099     buffer.size = sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE;
00100     memcpy (buffer.packets, input_fist, ( sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE));
00101                         
00102     send(spam_sock, &buffer, sizeof(bro_spam_fists_t), 0);
00103     recv(spam_sock, out_fist, ( sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE ), 0);
00104     
00105     return 0;
00106 };
